sense.gloss: eight, 8
handling (e.g. knife, reins), control, use, -work (e.g. footwork)
dealing with (e.g. customers), management, disposal (esp. sale of goods)
outlet (e.g. for water or gas)
market (for something)
outlet (e.g. for excess energy), vent (e.g. for emotions)
to handle well, to handle deftly
to deal with, to manage, to settle, to sort, to process
to prepare (meat or fish) for cooking, to dress (meat, etc.), to cut and trim (fish)
to sell out (completely), to dispose of (all stock)
to untangle, to disentangle, to part, to arrange (e.g. the hem of a kimono)
to sell well, to sell out
to be worldly and understanding, to be sensible, to be straightforward, to be frank
to be sorted out, to be put in order, to be resolved, to be dealt with
freight handling, cargo sorting, disposal of goods
sale
handling, manipulation
to settle (a matter)
drainage
selling
to sell out
to sell widely, to sell on a large scale
swordplay, swordsmanship
drainage, draining
sales
footwork (in martial arts, sports, etc.)
battling to knock away the hands of one's opponent, in order to achieve an advantageous position
to drain away
to sell off, to dispose of
(one's) handling of the reins, how well one controls things
to cut, to slit, to cut open
defensive body movement (judo, kendo, etc.)
to drain, to flow (unobstructed), to run off
to sell well, to be in good demand
to exit the stage, to remove (a prop) from the stage
skillful handling of a kitchen knife

sdata.j: たくさん↑作↑↓つく↓っても↑捌↑↓さば↓ききれないから、↑控↑↓ひか↓えめにね。
sdata.e: If you make too many, we won't be able to sell them all, so don't go wild.

sdata.j: ↑日本↑↓にほん↓ではね、↑調理↑↓ちょうり↓↑師↑↓し↓は↑特別↑↓とくべつ↓な↑試験↑↓しけん↓を↑受↑↓う↓けないとフグを↑捌↑↓さば↓けないんだ。
sdata.e: In Japan, chefs must take a special exam to be allowed to prepare pufferfish.

sdata.j: ↑日本↑↓にほん↓では、↑料理↑↓りょうり↓↑人↑↓にん↓がフグを↑捌↑↓さば↓くためには、↑特別↑↓とくべつ↓な↑試験↑↓しけん↓を↑受↑↓う↓けなければならない。
sdata.e: In Japan, chefs must take a special exam to be allowed to prepare pufferfish.
